ideal_answer: Blockchain is like a digital notebook that everyone can see but no one can secretly change. Imagine a shared Google Doc where every change is recorded forever, and no one can erase or edit past entries. Instead of one company controlling it, thousands of computers around the world keep copies, making it nearly impossible to hack or fake. This is why it’s used for things like Bitcoin—to keep transactions secure and transparent without needing a bank in the middle.
